messages.text:
Hi all.
Can someone help me with this?

How much difference in AIC I should consider when I am doing backward deletion?

For forward addition I considered change in AIC for 2 points is significant. 
Is that correct?

Thank you

elements.text:
Hi all.
Can someone help me with this?

How much difference in AIC I should consider when I am doing backward deletion?

For forward addition I considered change in AIC for 2 points is significant. 
Is that correct?

Thank you

messages.text: There is no set rule for AIC, but if your models are nested you can use the log likelihood ratio test

elements.text: There is no set rule for AIC, but if your models are nested you can use the log likelihood ratio test

messages.text:
Hi all, i need some help with the resolution of Plots for VPC. When i mention the size(width, height) the dpi which i get is not what i intended. Is there a way to get plots by mentioning the dpi that is required? Below is the code i tried
```plot(AcphnVPC,
    size=(1800,1500),
    xlabel="Time (hours)",
    ylabel = "Concentration (mcg/mL)" ,
    titlefontsize=30,guidefontsize=25,
    markersize=7, markeralpha = 0.5, markercolor =:black,
    observations = true,
    observed_quantiles = false,
    simquantile_medians = true,
    ci_bands = true,
    legend=false, legendfontsize = 15,
    titlefontcolor = :black,
    linewidth =5,
     xtickfont = font(25),
     ytickfont = font(25))```

elements.text: Hi all, i need some help with the resolution of Plots for VPC. When i mention the size(width, height) the dpi which i get is not what i intended. Is there a way to get plots by mentioning the dpi that is required? Below is the code i tried

plot(AcphnVPC,
    size=(1800,1500),
    xlabel="Time (hours)",
    ylabel = "Concentration (mcg/mL)" ,
    titlefontsize=30,guidefontsize=25,
    markersize=7, markeralpha = 0.5, markercolor =:black,
    observations = true,
    observed_quantiles = false,
    simquantile_medians = true,
    ci_bands = true,
    legend=false, legendfontsize = 15,
    titlefontcolor = :black,
    linewidth =5,
     xtickfont = font(25),
     ytickfont = font(25))

messages.text: looks like you simulated an array of populations

elements.text: looks like you simulated an array of populations

messages.text:
when reading in data you need to use
`data = read_pumas(df, observations= ...` 
But in the model macro the `derived` block has to match up with `observations` and not the `observed` block for statistical modelling? I personally find this very confusing.

elements.text: when reading in data you need to use
data = read_pumas(df, observations= ...
But in the model macro the
derived
block has to match up with
observations
and not the
observed
block for statistical modelling? I personally find this very confusing.

100x accelerated uncertainty quantification of dynamical systems with Koopman Expectations? Come see how to use it with Pumas at the first Pumas 2.0 webinar at 12pm EST. Inviting the whole <https://twitter.com/hashtag/pharma?src=hashtag_click|#pharma>, <https://twitter.com/hashtag/julialang?src=hashtag_click|#julialang>, and <https://twitter.com/hashtag/sciml?src=hashtag_click|#sciml> community.

<https://form.jotform.com/210605786318054>
